revised_title: Ultrastructure and Function of the Osphradium in the Tertiary Relict Snail Campanile Symbolicum
tldr: The author examines the ultrastructure of the osphradium, a gill-like sense organ, in the Tertiary relict snail Campanile symbolicum. The osphradium is composed of sensory cells with aberrant cilia and pigment formations, as well as free nerve processes. The author discusses the functional and ecological significance of the osphradium and its unique features, which reflect the phylogenetic isolation of this relict snail.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Mollusca
